title: VirtualBox
details: An open-source virtualization software for running multiple operating systems on a single machine.

title: Netcat (nc)
details: A utility for reading and writing data across network connections using TCP or UDP.

title: Traceroute
details: Displays the route packets take to reach a destination across a network, useful for diagnosing path issues.

title: dig
details: A tool used for querying DNS name servers to retrieve domain name information.

title: nslookup
details: A command-line tool used for querying the Domain Name System to obtain domain name or IP address mappings.

title: Wireshark
details: A network protocol analyzer that captures and displays data packets for inspection and debugging.

title: TCPdump
details: A command-line packet analyzer that captures and filters network traffic for troubleshooting and analysis.

title: Nmap
details: A network scanning tool used to discover hosts, services, and vulnerabilities on a network.

title: Metasploit
details: A framework for developing and executing exploit code against target machines for security testing.

title: John the Ripper
details: A password recovery tool that performs dictionary and brute-force attacks on hashed passwords.

title: Hashcat
details: GPU-accelerated password recovery tool capable of cracking hashes using dictionary, brute-force, and hybrid attacks.
source: Used in cybersecurity coursework and password cracking exercises

title: iproute2 (ip)
details: Modern Linux networking suite for configuring routing tables, IP addresses, interfaces, and tunnels.
source: Used for inspecting and configuring network interfaces and routing on Linux systems

title: netstat
details: Legacy tool for displaying network connections, routing tables, and interface statistics.
source: Used to inspect socket states and open ports on local systems
